definition: Binary (Available/Not available) value for Availability facet
Array of item barcode values associated with/attached to bib record.
implementation details: Pull barcode value from each item record and write it to an array in top-level field

definition: Number of concurrent users (for a licensed e-resource)

implementation details: Should be NUMBER. This number can be mapped to a textual statement for display in the UI

definition: Date that record was fully cataloged/completed. If this specific date is not available from the system, you could use a record creation date instead. DO NOT map a "record updated" date to this field.
rationale: Subject librarians use this facet, combined with call number range, to produce/link to lists of newly available materials of interest to users
implementation details: Transform to standard date format; map to desired date ranges (last week, last month, etc)

definition: Language(s) of the content in the material(s) described by the record
rationale: Limit/narrow results by language. Many resources are in more than one language. Users studying languages should be able to find materials that are in "English and French" ;;; Display language names in record
implementation details: Map language codes to preferred language terms for display (if not storage/indexing) -- http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/languages.html or http://www.loc.gov/standards/codelists/languages.xml ;;; Retain order because 008 language code is the "main" or first language in the item; in 041, codes are assigned in order of importance/amount of content

definition: Local record id value used to create id (with prepended institution code)

definition: List of authors and other contributors, typically transcribed from title page. In legacy records, may contain other data from the 245 field that has not been subfielded by one of the other subfield codes.
Language code for non-Roman script data in field
The value of the statement of responsibility

vernacular treatment: pass through/store vernacular -- no special processing
definition: Chronological/time period terms from LCSH
rationale: Explode subject genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual chronological terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated chronological terms from different vocabularies separately;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

vernacular treatment: pass through/store vernacular -- no special processing
definition: Genre/form terms
rationale: Explode subject and genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual genre/form terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated genre terms from different vocabularies separately. I'll be making a case to POs that it's necessary to include terms from several non-LCSH vocabularies in this facet to make it at all useful.

vernacular treatment: pass through/store vernacular -- no special processing
definition: Geographic/region terms from LCSH
rationale: Explode subject genre headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual geographic terms
notes: field_name doesn't include name of a vocabulary because we've never treated chronological terms from different vocabularies separately;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

definition: Pre-coordinate subject headings
rationale: Display in record (in order); adaptive hyperlinking for browsing/exploring; feed into autosuggest and/or "related titles" features

definition: Script/language code for field
Value of the heading

vernacular treatment: pass through/store vernacular -- no special processing
definition: Topical terms from Library of Congress Subject Headings (LCSH)
rationale: Explode subject headings into segments to allow filtering/narrowing by individual topical terms
notes: field_name includes "lcsh" because in Endeca, we also have a Medical Subject headings topic facet -- erring on the side of being more specific earlier on, based on Luke's advice that it'd be easier to generalize things later on than to tease out lost specifics;;;TD-347 specifies "limited to LCSH," though Endeca data model allowed terms from other vocabularies to be mapped here

definition: related works not handled in a field such as Table of Contents
endeca equivalent: Collective Uniform Title;;;Journal Uniform Title;;;Main Uniform Title;;;Uniform Title

vernacular status: spec-ed in work_entry pattern -- implementation needed
note on display: Hyperlinked. Clicking this segment does an author search
definition: Author of the related work
Script/language code for field

vernacular status: spec-ed in work_entry pattern -- implementation needed
note on display: Hyperlinks on different segments of the title portion conduct queries on work_citation index
definition: Title of related work, respecting nonfiling indicators
endeca equivalent: Collective Uniform Title;;;Journal Uniform Title;;;Main Uniform Title;;;Uniform Title

vernacular status: spec-ed in work_entry pattern -- implementation needed
definition: Title of related work, ignoring nonfiling indicators
endeca equivalent: Collective Uniform Title;;;Journal Uniform Title;;;Main Uniform Title;;;Uniform Title

vernacular status: spec-ed in work_entry pattern -- implementation needed
note on display: In display, this value should have prefix: "Some editions have title: "
definition: Variant form of title of the related work, if recorded in field. Would most often be the title proper (from title page) when uniform title was recorded in main title element of field.
endeca equivalent: Collective Uniform Title;;;Journal Uniform Title;;;Main Uniform Title;;;Uniform Title

definition: Type of work_entry pattern
Main title of the item described by record
Script/language code for field
Main title, including any initial articles

vernacular treatment: pass through/store vernacular -- no special processing
definition: Main title with non-filing characters removed from beginning
rationale: Used for sorting results by title; mitigate weird search results when people omit initial articles from their queries.

Full display: Other details > Variant title: or Former title: depending on [type] value
definition: Variant titles, as well as former titles that are not cataloged on a separate record. (See https://github.com/trln/data-documentation/blob/master/argot/spec_docs/title_history.adoc for discussion)
endeca equivalent: Journal Title Abbreviation;;;Title Index;;;Journal Varying Title;;;Varying Titles

definition: Whether the variant title data should display. Defaults to true. If false, the title will be indexed but not displayed
rationale: Many variant titles repeat data recorded elsewhere in the record.

definition: Variant title data to be indexed if that value is different than what's in [value] element

Full display: Other details > Variant title: or Former title: depending on [type] value
definition: ISSN for former title

vernacular treatment: pass through/store vernacular -- no special processing
Full display: Other details > Variant title: or Former title: depending on [type] value
definition: Contextualizing label specific to the data in the field
Script/language code for field

note on display: Controls whether field label will be Variant title: or Former title:
definition: Type of variant title field

Full display: Other details > Variant title: or Former title: depending on [type] value
definition: Variant title data to be displayed and, if [indexed_value] element is not populated, indexed
Universal product code
implementation details: Follows misc_id pattern and documentation listed in https://github.com/trln/data-documentation/blob/master/argot/spec_docs/misc_id.adoc

vernacular treatment: pass through/store vernacular -- no special processing
definition: Universal product code. Qualifying info only
implementation details: Follows misc_id pattern and documentation listed in https://github.com/trln/data-documentation/blob/master/argot/spec_docs/misc_id.adoc

definition: Label for the ID. Will be either: "UPC" or "UPC (canceled or invalid)"
implementation details: Follows misc_id pattern and documentation listed in https://github.com/trln/data-documentation/blob/master/argot/spec_docs/misc_id.adoc

definition: Universal product code. Indexed numeric portion
rationale: Syndetics API data match point. Possible search term
implementation details: Follows misc_id pattern and documentation listed in https://github.com/trln/data-documentation/blob/master/argot/spec_docs/misc_id.adoc

argot-marc processor/pattern: array of serialized JSON strings not flattened

argot-marc processor/pattern: array of serialized JSON strings not flattened
Full display: Depends on url[rel] value. Documentation will clarify this
definition: The actual URL

argot-marc processor/pattern: array of serialized JSON strings not flattened
definition: If true, access to resource at URL is restricted to institutional affiliates (via IP range or authentication). If false, resource at URL is freely available to anyone. Defaults to true if not explicitly set.
rationale: Used to determine whether/how URLs will be shown in expand to TRLN for other institutions

vernacular treatment: pass through/store vernacular -- no special processing
argot-marc processor/pattern: array of serialized JSON strings not flattened
Full display: Depends on url[rel] value. Documentation will clarify this
definition: Link text
rationale: The text that will be made into a clickable hyperlink pointing to the url[href] value

argot-marc processor/pattern: array of serialized JSON strings not flattened
definition: URL relator, or type of URL
rationale: Different types of URLs need to be displayed in different parts of the record and/or labeled differently

note on display: Index, but don't display. Users don't care about vendor MARC record ids, but this is potentially a useful thing for staff to search on
definition: MARC record control number assigned by source other than OCLC
rationale: Staff search, possibly of use for rolling up e-resources or other format records, if institutions use the same MARC record source

definition: Collection/group names searchable but not displayed anywhere. Can be used to scope special searches, power various logic, etc.
